page.title: 07AMBERLEY SOCIAL LIFE
page.content: The population is about 500. Mainly retired people live in the conservation part of the village. Newer council houses, built after the two wars and recent privately-owned houses, have younger families. Shopping is done mainly in the one village store/Post Office. Other shopping is in Storrington, Worthing or Chichester of where people's work is. Nearly all houses have one or more cars. There is a mini-bus service. The railway is used to some extent. Amberley hosteleries are used mostly for drinks and evening meals. Cinema and theatre visits are infrequent but regular to Chichester, Worthing or London. Clubs and societies are mostly in Amberley. Few inhabitants are native. All look for a bus service, a speed limit and main road pavement.
